page.title: 11RACING STABLES II.
page.content: The 14 stable-lads,under the eye of the Head Lad,care for 3-4 horses each. "Mucking out" is 7.00/7.45 each day. Then they feed the horses on{WHEAT}and {"'NUTS"}and groom them thoroughly. The horses exercise in the 'yard,on the roads or on the Gallops.Not every horse is taken out and only those that do get an extra feed when they return. The 'lads return from lunch at 3.30 to "muck out" and feed the horses once more.All the tack is cleaned weekly. Winter training is hampered by icy roads and frozen ground.The soiled bedding,instead of going to a mushroom farm,is spread in a circle in the yard so they can,at least,do light work. These horses race at{YORK}and{EPSOM for example.The owner,advised by the trainer,chooses a jockey who,if he wins, will get 10% of the "purse" plus his Â£35 riding fee.
